item.title: Best Stardew Valley Mods For Beginners
item.description:
Summary

  • Stardew Valley mods help players learn the basics more easily.
  • Mods expand dialogue depth with villagers subtly.
  • Mods streamline gameplay tasks for a lighter experience.

Even with what many fans would say is a perfect design, Stardew Valley still has a very robust modding community who are constantly working to develop mods that change the way people can experience the game. These can help players learn the basics of the game that aren't as well-explained as they could be, or just give players some new cosmetics to look at when building out their farm. For those who are just starting in the game, though, some mods can make the initial phase a completely different experience.

The beginning section of the game is also the toughest part to get through. Getting a farm up and operational, and then streamlining those processes, is a long process that comes with plenty of confusion for anyone just getting into the game. This is why players may want to take a look at mods that can help with that beginning section. This topic has some of the best of those beginner-friendly mods that fans can install right now.

1 Lookup Anything

A Better Explainer

  • Helps players learn the basics of the game much easier
  • Mod Author: Pathoschild
  • Can be downloaded here

By far, one of the toughest parts of Stardew Valley is just knowing what everything is, and how they interact with each other. This includes everything from the various NPCs that inhabit Pelican Town to the minerals that can be found in the caves. Figuring out how to interact with these things can be difficult for first-timers.

That's why this mod is so great: it allows players to look up important information for everything in the game. It can even give players insight into the grow time of the many crops that they will work on. Overall, it gives players a better sense of everything around them.

2 Canon-Friendly Dialogue Expansion

A More Expansive Conversation

  • Gives more robust dialogue when speaking with villagers
  • Mod Author: Ben and WitchWeed
  • Can be downloaded here

There is true joy in getting to know the various villagers and characters that will be every player's neighbors in the game, and this mod helps to expand on that. It will take the already excellent dialogue and give even more depth to it. It's a pretty subtle change that won't mix up the basic gameplay, but help the world come alive.

Being able to have that connection to all the characters is a huge benefit. Stardew Valley just has such a rich lore to get into, and this mod helps make that even better.

3 Dear Diary

Write That Down

  • Incredibly helpful to write notes down when a player needs to
  • Mod Author: MissCoriel
  • Can be downloaded here

Being able to keep a concentrated record of everything can be a huge boon when playing through the game. There is a lot of information that is coming at a person at just about every turn. It can be tough to keep track of it all and keep moving forward to build out the farm.

This mod will allow players to keep their heads on straight by adding a diary for them to write in. This is tied to the F5 key, and players can write down whatever they need to in order to reference it later.

4 NPC Map Locations

Find Them Faster

  • Tracks where an NPC is on the map at all times
  • Mod Author: Bouhm and Pathoschild
  • Can be downloaded here

When a person has to track down a specific character in the game, it can be annoying to find out where they are. Every character has different locations they can be found in depending on the time of day and current season. It can feel overwhelming at first to keep it all together.

This mod will fix that by adding icons to the game's map to show where every character is at that moment. This means no more keeping the wiki up or keeping detailed notes on character patterns; players can just look at their map and see where they need to go.

5 To-Dew List

Track Everything

  • Makes an organized way to know what a person has to do
  • Mod Author: Jamie Taylor
  • Can be downloaded here

Every day in the game, a player will have to know what they need to do. It could be harvesting certain crops and planting some new ones, or delivering certain items to characters around the map. However, the game does not give players any information about that; it is usually up to them to determine what they do and when they do it.

To help with that, players can use this mod to make a list every day of what they want to do. It makes the entire experience easier for everyone to keep things organized.

6 Harvest With Scythe

Harvesting Made Easier

  • Helps harvest everything with the scythe
  • Mod Author: bcmpinc
  • Can be downloaded here

Harvesting in the game can be a little tricky. There are some things that have to be harvested one way and other materials that require another method. This can be a drag when a player is trying to do one action, but get it mixed up with another one and end up overwhelmed and confused.

This mod is here to help players streamline the entire process by allowing all crops to be harvested with the scythe. Not having to worry about which tool to bring eliminates a ton of burden in the game, and makes the experience lighter and easier to digest when first starting out.

7 Simple Teleport To NPCs

Cut Out The Travel

  • Allows players to warp to any NPC on the map whenever they want
  • Mod Author: daitsuku
  • Can be downloaded here

Sometimes the busy work of having to walk across a map to get to a specific NPC is a slog. They are spread out and can be found in so many different locations that it's just annoying. Cutting that time out of the gameplay can be a great way to progress the game at a much faster rate.

This mod does just that by giving players the chance to teleport to any NPC they want, whenever they want. Using the mod brings up a list of all the NPCs and players can simply select who they want to go see. It's easy and makes the whole thing much leaner.

8 Stardew Valley Expanded

A Better Farm For Beginners

  • Adds a new farm that is easier to manage than other options
  • Mod Author: FlashShifter
  • Can be downloaded here

There is one specific reason that this mod makes this list and that is because of the Grandpa's Farm that it adds. This farm is far easier to manage than other farm options in the game thanks to its smaller size. This is fantastic for new players looking to learn the ropes of building out a farm.

While it has plenty of other things that it adds to the game, this smaller farm is the cream of the crop for it. Being able to keep track of a farm more easily is a huge help for any new player coming to Pelican Town.

item.title: Lost Castle 2: Ethereal Nightmare Mode Guide
item.description:
Quick Links

  • What Is the Ethereal Nightmare Mode?
  • How Should You Unlock the Ethereal Nightmare Mode?
  • What Rewards Do You Get in the Ethereal Nightmare Mode?
  • What Is Soulstone Smelting?

Lost Castle 2 ’s hardcore roguelike experience doesn’t end after defeating the final boss—it actually intensifies. Once you finish your first playthrough, you’ll meet a new character who reveals that what you just completed was, well, just the beginning. To unlock the full experience, you’ll need to tackle the game on a new difficulty: Ethereal Nightmare .

If you're still processing the fact that everything you’ve endured so far was nothing compared to the game’s end-game content, you’ll want to know how Ethereal Nightmare works. That’s why we’ve put together this comprehensive guide to help you navigate Lost Castle 2 ’s toughest difficulty setting and maximize your rewards in this brutal game mode.

What Is the Ethereal Nightmare Mode?

Ethereal Nightmare mode is the ultimate end-game difficulty in Lost Castle 2 . It functions like the game’s New Game Plus, letting you unlock rare resources and gain permanent buffs for your weapons—something not available in the regular mode.

In this mode, you can ramp up the difficulty by adding debuffs to your character, such as reduced Alchemy Elixir capacity or lower HP. These debuffs unlock higher Nightmare Depths, which feature tougher levels with better rewards.

Ethereal Nightmare was introduced on January 15, 2025, as part of Lost Castle 2 ’s biggest update, Nightmare in the Dune. It replaces the previous Hard and Nightmare difficulties, offering a more unique and unpredictable way to experience the game’s NG+ content.

Nightmare Depth

As you ramp up the game’s difficulty through debuffs in the Ethereal Nightmare mode, you'll unlock higher Nightmare Depths. These end-game levels boost enemy HP and damage, increase the number of monsters you face, and make boss fights even more challenging—all in exchange for rarer rewards like high-level Soulstones and Soul Flowers . On top of that, you’re more likely to encounter Champion Relics in the deeper Nightmare Depths. (See below for more details on each of these items.)

Nightmare Depths must be unlocked in chronological order. To reach Nightmare Depth 2, you'll need to first defeat Depth 1 and so on.

How Should You Unlock the Ethereal Nightmare Mode?

Ethereal Nightmare mode unlocks after you defeat Lost Castle 2 ’s final boss for the first time. Following the boss fight, a short cutscene introduces a new NPC, Nia. She will grant you access to the Ethereal Nightmare device in the camp, letting you increase the game’s difficulty or unlock Soul Inscriptions.

You will need a well-built class in Lost Castle 2 to beat the Ethereal Nightmare mode. I’d recommend going with a tank class for better survivability.

What Rewards Do You Get in the Ethereal Nightmare Mode?

Each time you complete an adventure in Ethereal Nightmare mode, you’ll earn Soulstones, Soul Flowers, and Champion Relics. Like all other rewards, these rare items drop randomly, but their drop rate improves the deeper you go and the higher-level bosses you defeat.

Ethereal Nightmare Reward

Effect

Soulstone

Unlocks buffs for weapons

Soul Flower

Unlocks a weapon’s hidden potential

Champion’s Relic

Unlocks a random weapon potential

Here’s what each of these Ethereal Nightmare items does:

Soulstone

Think of Soulstones as primary buffs for your weapons. They can provide general boosts, like increased ATK or SPD, to your weapon of choice in Lost Castle 2 . However, before using a Soulstone, you must first unlock that weapon’s initial Soul Inscription. To do this, you’ll need one of the following items: Soul Flowers or Champion Relics.

Soul Flower

When you find a Soul Flower, you can unlock a weapon’s hidden potential. Soul Flowers come in two rarities, and unlocking higher-level potentials (Soul Inscriptions) requires the rarer ones.

Be sure to talk to Nia after each round of the Ethereal Nightmare adventure. She will reward you with Soul Flowers, regardless of whether you succeed or fail in the adventure.

Champion’s Relic

A Champion’s Relic is a memory of a past warrior. When you find one, a random weapon in your inventory will gain a free Soul Inscription. The catch is that you can’t choose how to use them—they’re activated as soon as you pick them up, saving you the Soul Flowers you’d typically spend to unlock a Soul Inscription.

What Is Soulstone Smelting?

A patch in January 2025 introduced Soulstone Smelting to Lost Castle 2 . This feature lets you place ten unwanted Soulstones into a device to receive three new ones in return. If you use high-level Soulstones for smelting, your chances of forging rarer Soulstones are increased.

You’ll likely accumulate many unused Soulstones in your inventory because they’re plentiful in Ethereal Nightmare mode, and each weapon has limited slots for them. That’s why it’s a good idea to forge them into new Soulstones using the smelting feature, giving you a chance to create more powerful buffs.

item.title: Why One Marvel Rivals Character Easter Egg May Never Amount to More
item.description:
Marvel Rivals ’ roster of nearly 37 characters is astounding and showcases how expansive the Marvel pantheon’s breadth is. Equally as thrilling, though, is the handful of maps Marvel Rivals currently features and the iconic Marvel settings they represent. Anyone familiar with Marvel lore will surely be familiar with Asgard and Hydra, while a bit more deep-diving may be needed to learn about Klyntar.

One of Marvel Rivals ’ newest maps, Midtown, is easily its most recognizable yet with landmarks in a packed New York City referencing characters such as Daredevil and Dazzler. Funny enough, Midtown has a Fisk Tower skyscraper and its prominence would otherwise suggest that Kingpin himself might one day be introduced as a playable character. It’s entirely plausible that Dazzler or Daredevil could make their way into Marvel Rivals ’ roster at some point in the future, but the same may not be said for Wilson Fisk, a character whose supreme lack of any distinguishable qualities beyond being wide and unassumingly tough would make adapting him a nightmare.

Marvel Rivals’ Fisk Tower Easter Egg Could Tease Kingpin’s Arrival in the Future, But Should It?

Having Daredevil in Marvel Rivals would be exceptional and seems inevitable if NetEase truly intends to release a brand-new character every one-and-a-half months. That’s a tall order regardless of how many Marvel characters there are for the studio to draw out of a hat and it’ll be exciting to see which are revealed after the entire Fantastic Four has launched.

It’s possible NetEase’s well could run dry in a year or two and be forced to develop characters who aren’t as immediately intriguing, but Kingpin arguably wouldn’t make for an incredibly entertaining addition unless Marvel Rivals stretched its creative muscles in unprecedented ways.

Indeed, it would presumably be hard to flesh out Kingpin with a kit when Fisk is basically a spongy grappler without a defining quirk or hook to his character, let alone any actual reason as to why he’s as strong as he is. Kingpin is far more capable of being menacing in narratives where he’s orchestrating organized criminal activity and playing the role of a dutiful, stoic public figure.

There are countless other antagonist characters in Marvel lore that NetEase will hopefully consider before Kingpin, especially other colorful and zany Spider-Man villains, and if Marvel Rivals chose to erect Fisk Tower in Midtown it is maybe as a way to include an Easter egg for a character it wants to pay tribute to but never plans to add.

Marvel Rivals Would Need to Be Quite Creative to Make Kingpin Entertaining

Kingpin has long held his own in combat and the fact that he can go toe-to-toe with the likes of Spider-Man is undoubtedly impressive. Nonetheless, Marvel Rivals ’ characters all have a uniqueness to their abilities and kits that Kingpin wouldn’t have. Kingpin often wields a cane, for instance, but whatever gimmicks it could contain wouldn’t be enough to justify releasing him as a playable character alone.

Kingpin could employ external means at his disposal that could be representative of his crime lord status and wealth, but Marvel Rivals would find greater favor in plumbing Marvel’s darkest depths for obscure characters before ever landing on Kingpin. One of the only reasons why Kingpin would be a neat character to have added in Marvel Rivals is so that players could witness Fisk’s interactions with Spider-Man or Punisher, and if NetEase took liberties with him it’d be neat to see how he could contribute to Marvel Rivals ’ overarching lore.

Beyond that, it’d require quite a leap to give Kingpin enough moves and abilities to fill out a kit. Even as a Vanguard in Marvel Rivals , Kingpin would not be terribly unique and NetEase would probably need to make him overpowered at launch if it wanted players to choose him over the much more popular Doctor Strange, Groot, and Venom.

item.title: Virtua Fighter 5 R.E.V.O. Dev Talks Rollback Netcode, Rebalancing, and Franchise Future
item.description:
The legacy of Virtua Fighter looms large. A progenitor of 3D fighting games and a notoriously complex and mechanically rich series, Virtua Fighter has maintained a unique niche within the genre thanks to its emphasis on fundamentals. The arrival of Virtua Fighter 5 R.E.V.O. on Steam is an exciting move that sees the most recent entry in the series making its PC debut, albeit with the benefit of Virtua Fighter 5: Ultimate Showdown 's balancing updates, as well as the addition of rollback netcode for a smoother and more responsive competitive online experience and impressive new 4K visuals.

In celebration of Virtua Fighter 5 R.E.V.O. 's launch on Steam, Game Rant sat down with Virtua Fighter legacy project producer Siji Aoki to discuss how this newest release sets the stage for the franchise's revival. While Ryu Ga Gotoku Studio is hard at work on the next mainline Virtua Fighter game, Virtua Fighter 5 R.E.V.O. is stepping in as the new definitive release of 2006's Virtua Fighter 5 and prepping PC players for the legendary series' return to the platform. This interview has been edited for brevity and clarity.

Changes That Virtua Fighter 5 R.E.V.O. Brings to the Table

Q: For new and returning players, what are some of the most exciting reasons to play Virtua Fighter 5 R.E.V.O. ?

A: The implementation of rollback netcode which provides an environment where players will be able to play online comfortably without any stress, and the game balance adjustments for the first time in 13 years, which we feel creates a fair start for everyone.

Q: Can you walk us through what separates Virtua Fighter 5 R.E.V.O. from previous versions such as Final Showdown and Ultimate Showdown ?

A: The main differences between this and Virtua Fighter 5: Final Showdown and Virtua Fighter 5: Ultimate Showdown are that it supports rollback netcode and has a maximum internal resolution of 4K and a frame rate of 60fps.

Q: What were some challenges in integrating rollback netcode into Virtua Fighter 5 R.E.V.O. ?

A: Adding a new rollback netcode function to legacy source code from 13 years ago was certainly a technical challenge, but it became possible through the meticulous efforts of excellent programmers.

Q: Is Virtua Fighter 5 R.E.V.O. ’s balancing similar to the most recent PlayStation 4 version ( Ultimate Showdown ) or have there been any tweaks specific to the new release?

A: The game balance adjustments for the PS4 versions of Virtua Fighter 5: Ultimate Showdown and Virtua Fighter 5 R.E.V.O. are exactly the same.

Q: For someone who might be jumping into the Virtua Fighter series for the first time with Virtua Fighter 5 R.E.V.O. , what would you say are the definitive elements that separate it from other contemporary fighting franchises?

A: We take great pride in the fact that Virtua Fighter focuses more on the fighting itself than flashy effects and combining this with the fact that the game can also be played in a variety of ways using simple controls with just three buttons, we feel sets it apart from other modern fighting games.

Virtua Fighter's Future on PC

Q: With Virtua Fighter 5 R.E.V.O. ’s focus on online competitive play, will the team and SEGA be paying close attention to player counts to determine whether to bring future entries to PC?

A: In the fighting game scene these days, we think that demand for PC is increasing. We expect this trend to continue to accelerate, so we think that PC support will be essential in the future.

Q: Despite being playable in Virtua Fighter 5 Final Showdown , Dural is notably absent from Virtua Fighter 5 R.E.V.O. Are there any plans to rebalance the character and make her playable if player response calls for it?

A: The development team considered this, and we feel that Dural is not necessary as a playable character in a highly competitive Virtua Fighter 5: Ultimate Showdown and Virtua Fighter 5: R.E.V.O. setting. There are no plans to change this at this time, but we will consider adding her if there is strong user demand.

[END]

item.title: Minecraft Fan Creates Awesome Real-Life Chest Based on the Game
item.description:
Summary

  • A Minecraft player builds a real-life replica of the game's chest.
  • The Reddit community approves of the replica, admiring the design accuracy and functional features of the chest.
  • Other fans have created real-life replicas of Minecraft items.

Using their building skills, a Minecraft player has created a real-life replica of the game’s chests. While gamers often build incredible creations in Minecraft , this talented fan has revealed what one of the game’s blocks would look like in the real world, replicating the design with impressive precision.

Gamers who have played Minecraft for a short time understand the importance of storage, and the game’s chests help players save blocks for later use. Available to craft using a simple recipe of planks, the item can be reproduced easily, making inventory management in Minecraft somewhat easier. Due to its importance to the gameplay experience, one player decided to make a tribute to block in the real world.

Taking to Reddit, a user known as Less_Computer_2908 shared pictures of their replica chest from the game. With cherry and black walnut wood as the primary parts, the fan created the iconic shape and coloration of the Minecraft block. Impressively, the design featured light brown as the primary color and dark brown for the accents, while they even included a silver-colored latch on the front. Not only did the chest look like its in-game counterpart, but it could similarly store additional items, giving it a practical purpose. According to Less_Computer_2908, the replica was slightly over a square foot. In addition, the design featured hinges that allowed the lid to lift upward, like in the game. All said, if the in-game block were to materialize in the real world, it would likely look exactly like this.

Minecraft Fan's Real-Life Chest Replica

Many in the Minecraft community have approved of the chest design, with the post gaining more than 3.6K upvotes so far. In the comments, one Reddit wondered how long the project took to complete, to which Less_Computer_2908 said it required around 20 hours of work spread out over approximately 5 weeks. To finish the build, they said six pieces of cherry wood and 21 pieces of black walnut were needed. Besides comments about the building, another fan claimed it was the most accurate chest recreation they had seen on the site, with others saying they could imagine the iconic creaking sound of the item while looking at it.

Given the popularity of Minecraft , Less_Computer_2908 is not the first to try their hand at real-life replicas of in-game items. For example, another fan previously gave their bookshelf a Minecraft makeover, adding the recognizable design of the block to real-world furniture. In addition, one another game made a recreation of the game’s cake, putting an edible twist on the item.

Besides fan projects, there is a lot of official Minecraft -related news to be excited about. Along with the April 4 release of A Minecraft Movie , Mojang has started revealing content for its next game drop. Specifically, the developer has released several Snapshot/Beta and Preview updates for Minecraft , allowing players to test out things like new mob variants.
